required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluate the Efficacy &Safety of Methylphenidate Transdermal System (MTS) in Adolescents Aged 13-17 Years With ADHD
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase IIIb, Randomized, Double-Blind, Multi-Center, Parallel-Group, Placebo-Controlled, Dose Optimization Study, Designed to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of MTS in Adolescents Aged 13-17 Years With ADHD

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the efficacy and safety of efficacy of MTS compared to placebo

detailed_description.textblock: To assess the efficacy and safety of efficacy of MTS compared to placebo, as determined by the change in the clinician completed ADHD Rating Scale - Version 4th Edition (ADHD-RS-IV), in the symptomatic treatment of adolescents (aged 13-17 years) diagnosed with ADHD.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder Rating Scale-fourth Edition (ADHD-RS-IV) Total Score at Endpoint
primary_outcome.description: The Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder Rating Scale-fourth edition (ADHD-RS-IV) consists of 18 items scored on a 4-point scale ranging from 0 (no symptoms) to 3 (severe symptoms) with total score ranging from 0 to 54.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Conner's Parent Rating Scale-Revised (CPRS-R) Total Score at Endpoint
secondary_outcome.description: The Conner's Parent rating Scale-revised short version (CPRS-R) consists of 27 questions graded on a scale from 0 (not true at all) to 3 (very much true).

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement in Clinical Global Impressions-Improvement (CGI-I) Score
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical Global Impression-Improvement (CGI-I) consists of a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement includes a score of 1 (very much improved) or 2 (much improved) on the scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement in Parent Global Assessment (PGA) Score
secondary_outcome.description: Parent Global Assessment (PGA) consists of a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement includes a score of 1 (very much improved) or 2 (much improved) on the scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Youth Quality of Life-research Version (YQOL-R) Total Score at Endpoint
secondary_outcome.description: The Youth Quality of Life Instrument-research version (YQOL-R) is a validated 56-item generic instrument for comparing quality of life of adolescents across condition groups that scores each question on a scale from 0 (never) to 4 (very often).
Mean dermal reaction scores were graded on a scale ranging from 0 (no irritation) to 7 (strong reaction) for observed findings of erythema, edema, papules, and vesicles.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Electrocardiogram Results(QTcF Interval) at Endpoint
secondary_outcome.description: QTcF is the QT interval using Fridericia's correction formula. QT interval is a measure of time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave and is dependent on the heart rate(e.g., the faster the heart rate, the shorter the QT interval). The QT interval has to be corrected in order to aid interpretation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Pulse Rate at Endpoint
Change From Baseline in Systolic Blood Pressure at Endpoint
Change From Baseline in Diastolic Blood Pressure at Endpoint
Change From Baseline in Weight at Endpoint

other_outcome.measure: Post Sleep Questionnaire (PSQ) Quality of Sleep
other_outcome.description: Post Sleep Questionnaire (PSQ) overall rating of quality of sleep. There are 5 rating responses ranging from very poor to very good. No numbers are associated with the rating responses.

arm_group.description: dose optimization of 4 doses of the MTS transdermal patch over the same duration of wear
Daily application of matching MTS Placebo Patch

intervention.description: dose optimization of 4 doses of the MTS transdermal patch over the same duration of wear

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subject must meet criteria for a primary diagnosis of ADHD based on a detailed psychiatric evaluation.
2. Subject must have a total score of â‰¥26 on the ADHD-RS-IV at the Baseline Visit (Visit 2).
3. Subject must have a minimum level of intellectual functioning, as determined by an IQ (based on Kaufman Brief Intelligence Test [KBIT]) score of 80 or above.
4. Subject has blood pressure measurements within the 95th percentile for age, gender, and height at Screening and Baseline.
5. Subject is a male or female aged 13 17 years.
6. Females must have a negative serum beta Human Chorionic Gonadotropin (HCG) pregnancy test at Screening and a negative urine pregnancy test at Baseline and agree to use acceptable contraceptives throughout the study period and for 30 days after the last dose of IP.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subject has a current, controlled (requiring a restricted medication) or uncontrolled, with significant symptoms such as Post Traumatic Stress Disorder, psychosis, bipolar illness, pervasive developmental disorder, severe obsessive compulsive disorder, severe depressive or severe anxiety disorder.
2. Subjects who, in the opinion of the Investigator, are acutely at risk for suicidal or violent behavior towards him/herself or others, or a history of a suicide attempt requiring medical intervention.
3. Subject is overweight.
4. Subject has a history of seizures during the last 2 years, a tic disorder, a current diagnosis and/or family history of Tourette's Disorder.
5. Subject has Conduct Disorder.
6. Subject has a positive urine drug or alcohol result at Screening (with the exception of subject's current stimulant therapy, if any).
7. Subject has a history of alcohol or other substance abuse or dependence.
8. Subject has taken an investigational drug within 30 days prior to screening.
9. Subject has any abnormal thyroid function.
10. Subject has any clinically significant laboratory abnormalities.
11. Subject has severe allergic rhinitis, disability, or other condition that might confound the results of safety assessments administered in the study or that might increase risk to the subject. Mild, stable asthma is not exclusionary.
12. The female subject is pregnant or lactating.
13. Subject has any skin disease, or history of any chronic skin disease, skin cancer, skin manifestations of allergic disease, or other dermatologic conditions which would interfere with trial assessments or compromise subject safety (e.g. dermatitis, eczema or psoriasis).
14. Subject has sensitive-skin syndrome (definition: subjects who often develop nonspecific skin irritancy reactions to bland materials) or has sensitivities to the ingredients in soaps, lotions, cosmetics or adhesives.
15. Subject has clinical signs and symptoms of skin irritation (i.e., pruritus, burning, erythema) or scars or tattoos.

facility.name: Oregon Center for Clinical Investigations, Inc.

results_reference.citation: Findling RL, Turnbow J, Burnside J, Melmed R, Civil R, Li Y. A randomized, double-blind, multicenter, parallel-group, placebo-controlled, dose-optimization study of the methylphenidate transdermal system for the treatment of ADHD in adolescents. CNS Spectr. 2010 Jul;15(7):419-30.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 217 subjects were enrolled and randomized. The study included a screening/washout period, a 5 week dose optimization period, a 2 week maintenance period, and a follow-up period.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder Rating Scale-fourth Edition (ADHD-RS-IV) Total Score at Endpoint
outcome.description: The Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder Rating Scale-fourth edition (ADHD-RS-IV) consists of 18 items scored on a 4-point scale ranging from 0 (no symptoms) to 3 (severe symptoms) with total score ranging from 0 to 54.
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) which included all randomized subjects who received at least one dose of MTS or PTS, and had one Baseline and at least one post-Baseline assessment.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in the Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder Rating Scale-fourth Edition (ADHD-RS-IV) Total Score at Endpoint
measure.description: The Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder Rating Scale-fourth edition (ADHD-RS-IV) consists of 18 items scored on a 4-point scale ranging from 0 (no symptoms) to 3 (severe symptoms) with total score ranging from 0 to 54.
measure.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) which included all randomized subjects who received at least one dose of MTS or PTS, and had one Baseline and at least one post-Baseline assessment.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis was that there is no difference between MTS and placebo.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the Conner's Parent Rating Scale-Revised (CPRS-R) Total Score at Endpoint
outcome.description: The Conner's Parent rating Scale-revised short version (CPRS-R) consists of 27 questions graded on a scale from 0 (not true at all) to 3 (very much true).

measure.title: Change From Baseline in the Conner's Parent Rating Scale-Revised (CPRS-R) Total Score at Endpoint
measure.description: The Conner's Parent rating Scale-revised short version (CPRS-R) consists of 27 questions graded on a scale from 0 (not true at all) to 3 (very much true).

outcome.title: Improvement in Clinical Global Impressions-Improvement (CGI-I) Score
outcome.description: Clinical Global Impression-Improvement (CGI-I) consists of a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement includes a score of 1 (very much improved) or 2 (much improved) on the scale.

measure.title: Improvement in Clinical Global Impressions-Improvement (CGI-I) Score
measure.description: Clinical Global Impression-Improvement (CGI-I) consists of a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement includes a score of 1 (very much improved) or 2 (much improved) on the scale.

outcome.title: Improvement in Parent Global Assessment (PGA) Score
outcome.description: Parent Global Assessment (PGA) consists of a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement includes a score of 1 (very much improved) or 2 (much improved) on the scale.

measure.title: Improvement in Parent Global Assessment (PGA) Score
measure.description: Parent Global Assessment (PGA) consists of a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement includes a score of 1 (very much improved) or 2 (much improved) on the scale.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Youth Quality of Life-research Version (YQOL-R) Total Score at Endpoint
outcome.description: The Youth Quality of Life Instrument-research version (YQOL-R) is a validated 56-item generic instrument for comparing quality of life of adolescents across condition groups that scores each question on a scale from 0 (never) to 4 (very often).

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Youth Quality of Life-research Version (YQOL-R) Total Score at Endpoint
measure.description: The Youth Quality of Life Instrument-research version (YQOL-R) is a validated 56-item generic instrument for comparing quality of life of adolescents across condition groups that scores each question on a scale from 0 (never) to 4 (very often).

outcome.title: Post Sleep Questionnaire (PSQ) Quality of Sleep
outcome.description: Post Sleep Questionnaire (PSQ) overall rating of quality of sleep. There are 5 rating responses ranging from very poor to very good. No numbers are associated with the rating responses.
outcome.population: Safety population (Note: not everyone in the safety population completed a sleep questionnaire)

measure.title: Post Sleep Questionnaire (PSQ) Quality of Sleep
measure.description: Post Sleep Questionnaire (PSQ) overall rating of quality of sleep. There are 5 rating responses ranging from very poor to very good. No numbers are associated with the rating responses.
measure.population: Safety population (Note: not everyone in the safety population completed a sleep questionnaire)

outcome.title: Dermal Response Scale (DRS) Scores
outcome.description: Mean dermal reaction scores were graded on a scale ranging from 0 (no irritation) to 7 (strong reaction) for observed findings of erythema, edema, papules, and vesicles.
outcome.population: Safety population which included all randomized subjects that received at least one dose of MTS or PTS.

measure.title: Dermal Response Scale (DRS) Scores
measure.description: Mean dermal reaction scores were graded on a scale ranging from 0 (no irritation) to 7 (strong reaction) for observed findings of erythema, edema, papules, and vesicles.
measure.population: Safety population which included all randomized subjects that received at least one dose of MTS or PTS.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Electrocardiogram Results(QTcF Interval) at Endpoint
outcome.description: QTcF is the QT interval using Fridericia's correction formula. QT interval is a measure of time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave and is dependent on the heart rate(e.g., the faster the heart rate, the shorter the QT interval). The QT interval has to be corrected in order to aid interpretation.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Electrocardiogram Results(QTcF Interval) at Endpoint
measure.description: QTcF is the QT interval using Fridericia's correction formula. QT interval is a measure of time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave and is dependent on the heart rate(e.g., the faster the heart rate, the shorter the QT interval). The QT interval has to be corrected in order to aid interpretation.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If a multicenter publication is not submitted within twelve (12) months after conclusion, abandonment or termination of the Study at all sites, or after Sponsor confirms there shall be no multicenter Study publication, the Institution and/or such Principal Investigator may publish the results from the Institution site individually.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Amaury Sanchez, Sr. Manager, Regulatory Affairs
